more.title: Lithium prices soar after Zimbabwe suspends export
more.description: Reuters China’s lithium price surged on Thursday after Zimbabwe suspended raw mineral exports, sparking concerns over supply disruptions, at a time when growing energy storage demand is projected to drive a boom in the market. The most traded lithium carbonate contract on the Guangzhou Futures Exchange jumped 6.07% to 178,020 yuan ($26,043.45) a metric ton [...]The post Lithium prices soar after Zimbabwe suspends export appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.description: EMBATTLED retail giant OK Zimbabwe has been placed under Corporate Rescue following a resolution passed by its board of directors, as the company battles a deepening financial crisis marked by heavy losses, store closures and declining creditor confidence. more.title: Parliament invites public input on Constitutional Amendment (No.3) Bill which proposes extension of presidential term
more.description: The Parliament of Zimbabwe has invited the public to submit their views on the proposed Constitution of Zimbabwe Amendment (No. 3) Bill (H.B. 1), 2026, following its recent gazetting.
